article.headline: Marist 74, Fairfield 72
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Will McClurkin buried a 3-pointer with two seconds left to give Marist a 74-72 victory Wednesday night in a battle for first place in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference. McClurkin, who scored a career-high 26 points, hit five 3-pointers, more than doubling his season total. Will Whittington scored 16 and Jared Jordan, who assisted on the game-winner, added 12 for Marist (9-7, 6-1 MAAC). Fairfield (8-8, 5-2) trailed 71-68 with 27 seconds left after McClurkin made a pair of free throws. But Tyquawn Goode scored, stole the ball and scored again, giving the Stags a 72-71 lead with 17 seconds remaining. But then Jordan, who had been stymied in his attempt to penetrate, found McClurkin on the left wing for the go-ahead 3-pointer. Terrence Todd led Fairfield with 21 points. Deng Gai scored 13 and Goode added 11. Marist, which shot 58 percent, had runs of 13-1 and 12-0 in the first half, but it only led 35-34 at the break after a Todd 3-point play in the final seconds. Neither team led by more than four points in a close second half. Marist made 10-of-18 from 3-point range.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
